page.heading: Welcome
page.text:
I'm your personal BuddyBot.
I'll give you advice on how to create
your very own robots! Turn to the next
page to get started.

§nContent:

page.heading: Basics
page.text:
Robots consist of multiple parts:
§nModules§r
Modules are the parts of your robot
which determine its functionality.
§nChipsets§r
Your robot's chipset defines its range of
operation
§nArmor§r
A robot isn't indestructible!
Therefore you have to equip it with armor
Currently only Chain, Iron, Gold and Diamond
chestplates are allowed.

page.heading: Recipes
page.text:
This mod adds a couple of different
recipes you need to craft, when you
want to create your own robots.
You'll find them on the following
pages.
In this manual we mainly describe
the basic recipes, but there are
specific recipes for each module and
chipset. To lookup those we recommend
tools like NotEnoughItems.
Also, we can't display recipes added
by add-ons to this mod here due to
technical reasons.

page.heading: Blank chipset
page.text:
The blank chipset is used as base
for all the other chipsets. Most chipsets
follow a shapeless pattern with the
blank one + a dust like Redstone,
Lapis Lazuli or Glowstone.

page.heading: Blank module
page.text:
The blank module is used as base
for all the other modules. Most modules
follow a shapeless pattern with the
blank one + block or item which fits
their function best.

page.heading: Factory controller
page.text:
The factory controller is used
as master block of a robot factory.
It holds all relevant data and also
is the main interface for users.
It's used in the factory structure.

page.heading: Factory frame
page.text:
The factory frame is used
as building part of the robot
factory. It doesn't have any
important function, but it's
rendered with connected textures.

page.heading: Factory glass
page.text:
The factory glass is used
as building part of the robot
factory. It doesn't have any
important function, but it's
rendered with connected textures.
It's not necessarily needed
in the structure.
